definition: (not of regular commerce) to sell or dispose of (goods etc)/to get rid of/to unload
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Avoid  alternative investments and private partnerships that might be hard to sell.
sentences.chinese: 不要做可能难于脱手的另类投资或私人合伙投资。

sentences.english: You need to catch the right wave at the right time and know when to get off.
sentences.chinese: 你需要在正确时间把握正确趋势，并且知道何时脱手。

sentences.english: The injury effectively rules out any plans United may have had of selling Anderson in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 这个伤病让曼联无法在夏季将安德森脱手。

sentences.english: The wicket-keeper fumbled the ball and dropped it.
sentences.chinese: 那个守门员居然笨手笨脚地脱手失掉了球。

sentences.english: If you stand up and get rid of is to add penalty time.
sentences.chinese: 如果站起来和脱手是要加罚时间的。

sentences.english: It feels it's easy to be out of hand when wielding forcibly ?
sentences.chinese: 感觉好像用力挥动会很容易脱手飞出去？
